definition: to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive

sentences.english: The raising of deposit insurance limit will help increase bank depositors confidence in their banks.
sentences.chinese: 提升存款保险极限将帮助增加他们的银行存户信心。

sentences.english: Any person or organization that keeps money in a band is a depositor.
sentences.chinese: 把钱存入银行的任何个人或组识都叫存户。

sentences.english: It guarantees the safety of depositors' checking and savings deposits in member banks.
sentences.chinese: 它保证安全的存户的检查和储蓄存款中的会员银行。

sentences.english: Published by the safeguard measures will not cover off-shore bank depositors .
sentences.chinese: 所公布的保障措施将不会覆盖离岸银行存户。

definition: remittance/funds paid to a bank account
to withdraw money/to take money out of the bank
Central Bank of the Republic of China (Taiwan)
to deposit (e.g. in a bank account)
cargo receipt/landing account/warehouse or storage receipt/CL:張|张[zhang1]
certificate of deposit/time deposit/abbr. for 定期存款|定期存款[ding4 qi1 cun2 kuan3]
security (property held against a loan)/mortgaged property
